stanford.androidlib.graphics

Class GSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • stanford.androidlib.graphics.GObject
      • stanford.androidlib.graphics.GSprite

  • public class GSprite
extends GObject

    This class can be useful for creating objects in basic 2D games. It represents a basic in-game entity with a position and size that can move with a given velocity and acceleration around the screen. It can also collide with other sprites. A sprite can be drawn as either a bitmap image or a GObject such as a rectangle/oval.

    Since we cannot possibly think of all possible attributes you would want to store inside your sprite objects, we provide an internal map of key/value pairs called 'extra' properties. You can call getExtra and setExtra to retrieve/store extra data inside any sprite.

      • bound

        public GSprite bound()
        Moves this sprite so that it is within the bounds of its canvas. If it is outside the bounds on a given edge, it will be moved to that edge, favoring the top/left edges if needed. This will use the canvas last passed to paint() if any.

      • bound

        public GSprite bound(Canvas canvas)
        Moves this sprite so that it is within the bounds of the given canvas. If it is outside the bounds on a given edge, it will be moved to that edge, favoring the top/left edges if needed.

      • bound

        public GSprite bound(RectF rect)
        Moves this sprite so that it is within the bounds of the given rectangle. If it is outside the bounds on a given edge, it will be moved to that edge, favoring the top/left edges if needed.

      • bound

        public GSprite bound(float leftX,
                     float topY,
                     float rightX,
                     float bottomY)
        Moves this sprite so that it is within the bounds of the given x/y area. If it is outside the bounds on a given edge, it will be moved to that edge, favoring the top/left edges if needed.

      • boundHorizontal

        public GSprite boundHorizontal()
        Moves this sprite so that it is within the horizontal (x) bounds of its canvas. If it is outside the bounds on a given edge, it will be moved to that edge, favoring the left edge if needed.

      • clearExtras

        public GSprite clearExtras()
        Removes all extra properties inside this sprite.

      • collidesWith

        public boolean collidesWith(GSprite otherSprite)
        Returns true if this sprite collides with the given other sprite. Collision is determined by the collision rectangles of the two sprites. By default this is just the bounding boxes of their bitmaps or GObjects. But if you have set a collision margin, then that margin is used here.

      • flipVelocity

        public GSprite flipVelocity()
        Inverts the sign of the sprite's velocity in both directions.

      • flipVelocityX

        public GSprite flipVelocityX()
        Inverts the sign of the sprite's velocity in the x direction.

      • flipVelocityY

        public GSprite flipVelocityY()
        Inverts the sign of the sprite's velocity in the y direction.

      • getAccelerationX

        public float getAccelerationX()
        Returns this sprite's x acceleration; this will be 0 unless you have called setAcceleration.

      • getAccelerationY

        public float getAccelerationY()
        Returns this sprite's yacceleration; this will be 0 unless you have called setAcceleration.

      • getBitmap

        public Bitmap getBitmap()
        Returns the bitmap for this sprite as passed to the constructor. If a GObject was passed instead, this will be null.

      • getBitmaps

        public ArrayList<Bitmap> getBitmaps()
        Returns the list of bitmaps for this sprite. If a GObject was passed instead, this will be null.

      • getCollisionMarginBottom

        public float getCollisionMarginBottom()
        Returns this sprite's collision margin in the y direction. This will be 0 unless you have called setCollisionMargin previously. The collision margin can be used to make a smaller collision rectangle for collision detection.

      • getCollisionMarginLeft

        public float getCollisionMarginLeft()
        Returns this sprite's collision margin in the x direction on the left side. This will be 0 unless you have called setCollisionMargin previously. The collision margin can be used to make a smaller collision rectangle for collision detection.

      • getCollisionMarginRight

        public float getCollisionMarginRight()
        Returns this sprite's collision margin in the x direction on the right side. This will be 0 unless you have called setCollisionMargin previously. The collision margin can be used to make a smaller collision rectangle for collision detection.

      • getCollisionMarginTop

        public float getCollisionMarginTop()
        Returns this sprite's collision margin in the y direction on top. This will be 0 unless you have called setCollisionMargin previously. The collision margin can be used to make a smaller collision rectangle for collision detection.

      • getCollisionMarginX

        public float getCollisionMarginX()
        Returns this sprite's collision margin in the x direction. This will be 0 unless you have called setCollisionMargin previously. The collision margin can be used to make a smaller collision rectangle for collision detection.

      • getCollisionMarginY

        public float getCollisionMarginY()
        Returns this sprite's collision margin in the y direction on top. This will be 0 unless you have called setCollisionMargin previously. The collision margin can be used to make a smaller collision rectangle for collision detection.

      • getCurrentBitmapIndex

        public int getCurrentBitmapIndex()
        Returns the index of the bitmap currently being displayed in this sprite's list of bitmaps.

      • getExtra

        public <T> T getExtra(String name)
        Returns the extra property inside this sprite with the given name. If the given extra property has not been previously set inside this sprite, returns null. The sprite's internal map of extra properties is meant as a catch-all to allow you to stuff arbitrary data inside a sprite that is useful for your particular game. The return type here is 'T' so you don't need to typecast.

      • getExtras

        public Bundle getExtras()
        Returns all extras in this sprite as a Bundle. This is a deep copy; modifying the bundle does not modify this sprite.

      • getFramesPerBitmap

        public int getFramesPerBitmap()
        Returns the number of frames of animation that each bitmap in the list should be displayed before automatically cycling to the next frame bitmap.

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight()
        Returns this sprite's height.
        Overrides:
        getHeight in class GObject

      • getShape

        public <T extends GObject> T getShape()
        Returns the GObject that was passed to this GSprite's constructor, if any.

      • getVelocityX

        public float getVelocityX()
        Returns this sprite's velocity in the x direction.

      • getVelocityY

        public float getVelocityY()
        Returns this sprite's velocity in the y direction.

      • getWidth

        public float getWidth()
        Returns the sprite's width.
        Overrides:
        getWidth in class GObject

      • getX

        public float getX()
        Returns this sprite's leftmost x-coordinate.
        Overrides:
        getX in class GObject

      • getY

        public float getY()
        Returns this sprite's top y-coordinate.
        Overrides:
        getY in class GObject

      • hasCollisionBoundary

        public boolean hasCollisionBoundary()
        Returns true if you have set a collision margin.

      • hasExtra

        public boolean hasExtra(String name)
        Returns whether this sprite has the given extra property inside it.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(GSprite otherSprite)
        Returns true if this sprite collides with the given other sprite. Collision is determined by the collision rectangles of the two sprites. By default this is just the bounding boxes of their bitmaps or GObjects. But if you have set a collision margin, then that margin is used here.

      • isCollidable

        public boolean isCollidable()
        Returns whether this sprite can be collided with. This will be true unless you have called setCollidable.

      • isInBounds

        public boolean isInBounds()
        Returns whether this sprite is within the bounds of its canvas. This will use the canvas last passed to paint() if any.

      • isInBounds

        public boolean isInBounds(Canvas canvas)
        Returns whether this sprite is within the bounds of the given canvas.

      • isInBounds

        public boolean isInBounds(RectF rect)
        Returns whether this sprite is within the bounds of the given rectangle.

      • isInBounds

        public boolean isInBounds(float leftX,
                          float topY,
                          float rightX,
                          float bottomY)
        Returns whether this sprite is within the bounds of the given x/y area.

      • isInBoundsHorizontal

        public boolean isInBoundsHorizontal()
        Returns whether this sprite is within the horizontal (x) bounds of its canvas. This will use the canvas last passed to paint() if any.

      • isInBoundsHorizontal

        public boolean isInBoundsHorizontal(Canvas canvas)
        Returns whether this sprite is within the horizontal (x) bounds of the given canvas.

      • isInBoundsHorizontal

        public boolean isInBoundsHorizontal(RectF rect)
        Returns whether this sprite is within the horizontal (x) bounds of the given rectangle.

                                    float rightX)
        Returns whether this sprite is within the horizontal (x) bounds of the given x area.

      • isInBoundsVertical

        public boolean isInBoundsVertical()
        Returns whether this sprite is within the vertical (y) bounds of its canvas. This will use the canvas last passed to paint() if any.

      • isInBoundsVertical

        public boolean isInBoundsVertical(Canvas canvas)
        Returns whether this sprite is within the vertical (y) bounds of the given canvas.

      • isInBoundsVertical

        Returns whether this sprite is within the vertical (y) bounds of the given rectangle.

      • isInBoundsVertical

        public boolean isInBoundsVertical(float topY,
                                  float bottomY)
        Returns whether this sprite is within the vertical (y) bounds of the given y area.

      • isLoopBitmaps

        public boolean isLoopBitmaps()
        Returns whether the sequence of bitmaps (as passed to the constructor or setBitmaps) should loop back to the first one after it ends. Default true.

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        Returns whether this sprite has a non-zero velocity in any dimension.

                      float y)

      • paint

        public void paint(Canvas canvas)
        Draws this sprite onto the given graphical canvas.
        Specified by:
        paint in class GObject

      • putExtra

        public GSprite putExtra(String name,
                        Object value)
        Sets the extra property inside this sprite with the given name. The sprite's internal map of extra properties is meant as a catch-all to allow you to stuff arbitrary data inside a sprite that is useful for your particular game. Equivalent to setExtra.

      • putExtras

        public GSprite putExtras(Bundle bundle)
        Adds all extras from the given Bundle into this Sprite. Does not clear any previously existing extras. Makes a deep copy. Equivalent to setExtras.

      • remove

        public GSprite remove()
        Removes this sprite from its graphical canvas, if it is added to one. Equivalent to calling remove(thisGSprite) on the object.
        Overrides:
        remove in class GObject

      • removeExtra

        public GSprite removeExtra(String name)
        Removes the extra property inside this sprite with the given name. The sprite's internal map of extra properties is meant as a catch-all to allow you to stuff arbitrary data inside a sprite that is useful for your particular game.

      • rotateVelocity

        public GSprite rotateVelocity(float degrees)
        Rotates this sprite's velocity in x and y dimension by the given angle in degrees, clockwise. For example, passing 90 is a 'right' turn, -90 is a 'left' turn, and 180 is an about-face.

      • scale

        public GSprite scale(float sf)
        Scales the sprite on the screen by the scale factor sf, which applies in both dimensions.
        Overrides:
        scale in class GObject
        Parameters:
        sf - The factor used to scale all coordinates in both dimensions
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if sf is not a positive number
        Usage:
        gobj.scale(sf);

      • scale

        public GSprite scale(float sx,
                     float sy)
        Scales the object on the screen by the scale factors sx and sy.
        Overrides:
        scale in class GObject
        Parameters:
        sx - The factor used to scale all coordinates in the x direction
        sy - The factor used to scale all coordinates in the y direction
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if sx or sy is not a positive number
        Usage:
        gobj.scale(sx, sy);

      • setAccelerationX

        public GSprite setAccelerationX(float accelerationX)
        Sets the x acceleration of this sprite. Acceleration will be applied on each tick of animation, increasing or decreasing the sprite's velocity.

      • setAccelerationY

        public GSprite setAccelerationY(float accelerationY)
        Sets the y acceleration of this sprite. Acceleration will be applied on each tick of animation, increasing or decreasing the sprite's velocity.

      • setAcceleration

        public GSprite setAcceleration(float accelerationX,
                               float accelerationY)
        Sets the x and y acceleration of this sprite. Acceleration will be applied on each tick of animation, increasing or decreasing the sprite's velocity.

      • setBitmap

        public GSprite setBitmap(Bitmap bitmap)
        Sets this sprite to use the given bitmap to draw itself. If the sprite has both a bitmap and a GObject set, the bitmap will take predence and will be drawn. If the sprite uses a cycle of multiple bitmaps, use setBitmaps instead.

      • setBitmaps

        public GSprite setBitmaps(ArrayList<Bitmap> bitmaps)
        Sets the list of bitmaps for this sprite.

      • setBitmaps

        public GSprite setBitmaps(Bitmap... bitmaps)
        Sets the list of bitmaps for this sprite.

      • setBounds

                         float y,
                         float width,
                         float height)
        Changes the bounds of this object to the specified values.
        Overrides:
        setBounds in class GObject
        Parameters:
        x - The new x-coordinate for the object
        y - The new y-coordinate for the object
        width - The new width of the object
        height - The new height of the object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is negative
        Usage:
        gimage.setBounds(x, y, width, height);

      • setCollidable

        public GSprite setCollidable(boolean collidable)
        Sets whether it is possible to collide with this sprite. If false, collidesWith will always return false.

      • setCollisionMargin

        public GSprite setCollisionMargin(float px)
        Sets a collision margin for this sprite. Collision is determined by the collision rectangles of the two sprites. By default this is just the bounding boxes of their bitmaps or GObjects. But if you have set a collision margin, then that margin is used here. For example, on a 20x20 pixel sprite, setting a collision margin of 5px would mean that only the innermost 10x10 pixels would count as a collision.

      • setCollisionMargin

        public GSprite setCollisionMargin(float pxX,
                                  float pxY)
        Sets a collision margin for this sprite on all four sides. Collision is determined by the collision rectangles of the two sprites. By default this is just the bounding boxes of their bitmaps or GObjects. But if you have set a collision margin, then that margin is used here. For example, on a 20x20 pixel sprite, setting a collision margin of 4px and 6px would mean that only the innermost 12x8 pixels would count as a collision.

      • setCollisionMargin

        public GSprite setCollisionMargin(float pxLeft,
                                  float pxTop,
                                  float pxRight,
                                  float pxBottom)
        Sets a collision margin for this sprite on all four sides. Collision is determined by the collision rectangles of the two sprites. By default this is just the bounding boxes of their bitmaps or GObjects. But if you have set a collision margin, then that margin is used here. For example, on a 20x20 pixel sprite, setting a collision margin of 4px and 6px would mean that only the innermost 12x8 pixels would count as a collision.

      • setCollisionMarginBottom

        public GSprite setCollisionMarginBottom(float pxBottom)
        Sets a collision margin for this sprite on the bottom side.

      • setCollisionMarginLeft

        public GSprite setCollisionMarginLeft(float pxLeft)
        Sets a collision margin for this sprite on the left side only.

      • setCollisionMarginRight

        public GSprite setCollisionMarginRight(float pxRight)
        Sets a collision margin for this sprite on the right side only.

      • setCollisionMarginTop

        public GSprite setCollisionMarginTop(float pxTop)
        Sets a collision margin for this sprite on the top side.

      • setCollisionMarginX

        public GSprite setCollisionMarginX(float pxX)
        Sets a collision margin for this sprite on the left and right sides.

      • setCollisionMarginX

        public GSprite setCollisionMarginX(float pxLeft,
                                   float pxRight)
        Sets a collision margin for this sprite on the left and right sides.

      • setCollisionMarginY

        public GSprite setCollisionMarginY(float pxY)
        Sets a collision margin for this sprite on the top and bottom sides.

      • setCollisionMarginY

        public GSprite setCollisionMarginY(float pxTop,
                                   float pxBottom)
        Sets a collision margin for this sprite on the top and bottom sides.

      • setGCanvas

        Sets the canvas on which this GObject should be drawn. You probably should not call this directly, and should call add(GObject) on the canvas instead. If gcanvas is null, this object will not be associated with any canvas.

        Noshow:

      • setVelocity

        public GSprite setVelocity(float dx,
                           float dy)
        Sets this sprite to move with the given velocity. Every time update() is called, its x/y position will change by the given dx and dy amounts.

      • setVelocityX

        public GSprite setVelocityX(float dx)
        Sets this sprite to move with the given velocity in the x direction. Every time update() is called, its x position will change by the given dx amount. dy is unchanged by this call.

      • setVelocityY

        public GSprite setVelocityY(float dy)
        Sets this sprite to move with the given velocity in the y direction. Every time update() is called, its y position will change by the given dy amount. dx is unchanged by this call.

      • setVisible

        public GSprite setVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets whether this object is visible.
        Overrides:
        setVisible in class GObject

      • setX

        public GSprite setX(float x)
        Sets the x-location of this object. The y-location is unchanged.
        Overrides:
        setX in class GObject

      • setY

        public GSprite setY(float y)
        Sets the y-location of this object. The x-location is unchanged.
        Overrides:
        setY in class GObject

      • stop

        public GSprite stop()
        Halts the object, setting its velocity and acceleration to 0.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this sprite for debugging, including its GObject if any, and its collision rectangle.
        Overrides:
        toString in class GObject
        Returns:
        a string representation of the object.

      • translate

        public GSprite translate(float dx,
                         float dy)
        Moves the object on the screen using the displacements dx and dy.
        Overrides:
        translate in class GObject

      • update

        public void update()
        Called by SimpleCanvas every time the animation ticks. Moves the sprite by dx and dy and applies acceleration.
